description: Number of blocks of {0, 0, 1} in binary expansion of n.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digit Block
formula: a(2n) = a(n), a(2n+1) = a(n) + [n congruent to 0 mod 4]. - _Ralf Stephan_, Aug 22 2003
mathematica: a[n_, bits_] := (idn = IntegerDigits[n, 2]; ln = Length[idn]; lb = Length[bits]; For[cnt = 0; k = 1, k <= ln - lb + 1, k++, If[idn[[k ;; k + lb - 1]] == bits, cnt++]]; cnt); Table[ a[n, {0, 0, 1}], {n, 1, 102} ] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Oct 23 2012 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
